reviews.review: Better than the modern shooter, here you kan learn how to play !

Put about 16 hours into this game, it was pretty fun.   This game encourages you to want to capture the flags and sneak around to give your team the upper hand.

Unfortunately I felt the gameplay was limited because of map size and sound effects.  I loved the original for the sounds but this new version sounded flat and didn't make me feel apart of the action.

Not bad, but not super awesome.

9/10

Pros

-Sounds
-Animations
-Models
-The weapons feel amazing and are extremely satisfying to fire
-Harsh learning curve 
-Teams benefit greatly from cooperation
-Well designed maps with choke points and hiding places
-You can throw enemy grenades back lololol
-No exp system, Allah be praised

Cons

-I enjoy the soldier class system, but perhaps some customization could be allowed for weapons and characters?

A really great game. Just remember to follow this special creed or you won't be able to enjoy this game to the fullest extent:

Don't worry about having more deaths than kills. After all, this isn't Counter Strike: Source, right? 

The only exception to this would be if you're playing as a sniper or a machine gunner for an extensive amount of time. Seriously, if you keep dying and you're not getting kills playing as CAMPING classes, then you ought to switch to a different class.
If you're looking for a twitch based, WW2 action arcade FPS game then you've come to the right place. Maps are tight but balanced - the game is fast and brutal and will keep you on your toes.

World War 2 themed FPS. It is simple and straight foward; no vehicles, small maps, simple weaponry, no fancy graphics and thus a game you can enjoy easily. Although, at times, it does feel somewhat heavier and slower compared to the fast, rather individual and arcade like Counter Strike. Sound effects are decent and the shooting system feels great too. It may have been some while since this game was released, but its no-frill style gameplay still makes Day of Defeat a great entertainment.
This game is all about how well you can camp and twitch shoot. If you can't operate as a one man army, you probably aren't helping.
The best multiplayer WW2 game I've ever played, and its only 10 bucks.

You don't know recoil till you've played DoD Source.  I swear to god, the first bullet hits the target, and the second bullet hits the sun.

To sum up this game in a word: unforgiving. 

It is essentially a team based point capture game that encourages teamwork, not  through planning or thinking tactically about an objective, but more along the lines of what area the team is weakest in at that given point. 

The frustration of the individual team members helps create a coherent fighting force, that can at least hold the critical point just long enough to win.

Communication is generally lax, but as with a public server in counterstrike, you can bet on the over ambitous, bloodthirsty nature of your fellow gamers to see you through. 

The level design of the official maps clearly lean towards the highly competitive side,  resulting in both fast paced rounds lasting 30 seconds, to  meat grinder matches where you spend the next 30 minutes on one side of a chokepoint. 

The mod community makes the game up though, and there are plenty of map types for all kinds of playstyles. 

It's a good game, just utterly butal when starting.

A definitive WWII shooter. Take your 'Call of Duty' and get lost, this is the real deal. Sure, there isn't a single-player campaign, but then again, most FPS players don't tend to care about that. Sure, 'Call of Duty' has a great single-player campaign (depending on the game), but this is so much cheaper, and the multiplayer gives as much, maybe more, fun than the COD multiplayer. Dedicated servers, with a lovely community, and plenty of official and player made maps make this leaps ahead of Call of Duty's multiplayer. A necessary purchase for any FPS fan, or any gamer that wants a great game at a great price.
9/10
One of my favorite world war 2 era shooters of all time. Would definitely recommend to anyone.

I never really liked Day of Defeat because there were a whole lot of WWII games that were released around the same time that did things so much better. The Source version doesn't feel like a vast improvement over the original game, but surprisingly you can still find an occasional populated server. I suppose if you need some basic old school WWII combat, this can fit the bill.

I do recommend this game, its alot of fun and I have had some great times playing it. There are several classes you can choose from and each lets you utilize WW2 weaponry depending if you are Ally or Axis.

My personal prefrence is to be an Axis sniper for the scope on the rifle. The Springfield on the Ally side is just as good but I find the crosshair to be in the way.

Buy it!

В те далекие времена, когда деды воевали, все было по-настоящему. Солдаты храбро сражались за Родину, до последней капли крови. Сейчас, у игроков есть шанс побывать на полях сражений Второй Мировой абсолютно ничем не рискуя. Скорее, хватай винтовку (мышку) и вперед (нажимай кнопку W) солдат, на амбразуру! 

Это Вам не Half-Life, и даже не Call of Duty. Тут все по-настоящему (нет). Отдохните от бесконечного Counter-Strike, попробуйте проявить себя в Day of Defeat! :)

This game is an excellent class based team shooter with a heavy emphasis on clunky weapons with a lot of recoil. It rewards team play and often times most classes are limited to 2 or even 1 player on a team while the rest play a standard rifleman class. The game still has a dedicated player base even after all this time. Sadly, the players aged with the game and you'll find American servers moderated by literal baby boomers who's sole purpose in life is to tell people not to make political jokes or shoot in spawn. The unfortunate part is you're forced to play on these types of servers because they're the only populated servers most of the time.

TL:DR If you'd like a source team shooter based in WW2, but also don't mind dealing with grumpy old people/playing on russian servers go for it.
